flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=52>>52 photos.
When Tim has 52 photos, then Paul has 52 + 10 photos = <<52+10=65>>65 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 52 photos + 65 photos = <<52+65=117>>117 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 117 photos = <<152-117=35>>35 photos.
#### 35

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 62, not 65. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
